result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles L Champion was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court waived DNA surcharge due to the defendant's inability to pay.
Pay all other  costs, fees and surcharges through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: Participate in educational programming at the institution and on extended supervision to obtain HSED/GED.  Participate in vocational training.

No contact with the victim.
May not maintain any social media accounts.

Complete sex offender evaluation and comply with recommended treatment/counseling.
Comply with rules set forth by agent.
Any electronic devices must be turned over to agent for inspection upon demand.
Pay restitution as ordered in case 14CF2561.
AODA assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety from all illegal drugs and alcohol.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; further advised that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles L Champion

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA AND SENTENCING Transcript (62 pages) commencing 04/22/15 received and filed.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1 as AMENDED-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Court advised the defendant that upon a conviction of this offense he may be subject to Chapter 980 proceedings.
Court advised the defendant of the sex offender registry requirements.

Defendant Charles L Champion in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Charles L Champion in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for arraignment. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State filed an Amended Information. Defendant charged as follows:

COUNT 1- Third Degree Sexual Assault, contrary to sec. 940.225(3), 939.50(3)(g) Wis. Stats., a Class G Felony.

Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of the amended information and waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty at this time.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Charles L Champion not in court, in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Arraignment. Original Information received and filed. Case heard off the record. Defendant NOT produced. Court held in chambers discussion with both parties. Court ordered Arraignment be adjourned. Case adjourned to branch 25.  Arraignment scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.

Defendant Charles L Champion in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Charles L Champion in custody.  Ron Dague for Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  No District Attorney file in court. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  
Court ordered case adjourned for Arraignment to Branch 25.  Arraignment scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons  or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JW dob 7/21/95

Defendant Charles L Champion in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Charles L Champion in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
